get.description: Returns a specific document belonging to the authenticated user's account.

Returns a temporary download URL for the document file, valid for 1 hour.
The URL forces a download with the original filename.
Returns all orders belonging to the authenticated user's account.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Available sorts are `created_at`, `number`, `status`, `total`, `completed_at`. You can sort by multiple options by separating them with a comma. To sort in descending order, use `-` sign in front of the sort, for example: `-created_at`.

path.description: Base path for paginator generated URLs.

per_page.description: Number of items shown per page.

to.description: Number of the last item in the slice.

total.description: Total number of items being paginated.

get.description: Returns a specific order belonging to the authenticated user's account.

put.description:
Updates the custom_reference and/or custom_metadata for an order.
For custom_metadata, keys are merged with existing data. Set a key to null to remove it.
Maximum 64 keys allowed in custom_metadata.

get.description: This tests the validity of the API credentials provided and responds with `pong` if successful.
Returns all quotes belonging to the authenticated user's account, excluding pending quotes.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Available sorts are `created_at`, `number`, `status`, `expires_at`, `requested_at`. You can sort by multiple options by separating them with a comma. To sort in descending order, use `-` sign in front of the sort, for example: `-created_at`.

path.description: Base path for paginator generated URLs.

per_page.description: Number of items shown per page.

to.description: Number of the last item in the slice.

total.description: Total number of items being paginated.

get.description: Returns a specific quote belonging to the authenticated user's account.
Returns all users belonging to the authenticated user's account, with their teams.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Available sorts are `created_at`, `first_name`, `last_name`, `email`. You can sort by multiple options by separating them with a comma. To sort in descending order, use `-` sign in front of the sort, for example: `-created_at`.

path.description: Base path for paginator generated URLs.

per_page.description: Number of items shown per page.

to.description: Number of the last item in the slice.

total.description: Total number of items being paginated.

get.description: Returns a specific user belonging to the authenticated user's account, with their teams.

id.description: The unique identifier for the cart (e.g. cart_xxxxx).

is_individual.description: Whether this is an individual (non-business) order.

physical_copy.description: Whether a physical copy was requested.

id.description: The unique identifier for the document (e.g. doc_xxxxx).

page_count.description: The number of pages in the document.

word_count.description: The word count of the document.

character_count.description: The character count of the document.

source_language_code.description: The ISO 639-1 language code of the source document.

id.description: The unique identifier for the order (e.g. ord_xxxxx).

url.description: The URL to view this order in the Portal.

custom_reference.description: A custom reference provided by the customer.

custom_metadata.description: Custom metadata attached to the order.

id.description: The unique identifier for the quote (e.g. quot_xxxxx).

url.description: The URL to view this quote in the Portal.

has_guaranteed_delivery.description: Whether a guaranteed delivery date is set.

total_cents.description: The total in cents, computed from quote items.

price.description: The line item price in cents.

subtotal.description: The line item subtotal in cents (price × quantity).

id.description: The unique identifier for the team.

is_default.description: Whether this is the account's default team.

role.description: The authenticated user's role on this team.

id.description: The unique identifier for the user.

teams.description: The teams the user belongs to.

errors.description: A detailed description of each field that failed validation.
